titles.title: Disapproving the action taken by the President under section 203 of the Trade Act of 1974 transmitted to the Congress on March 5, 2002.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means
House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 107-437.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 259.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 414 Reported to House. Upon the adoption of this resolution, H.J. Res. 84 is laid on the table.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 414, H.J. Res. 84 is laid on the table.

bill.summary: 5/7/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Disapproves the action taken by the President under section 203 of the Trade Act of 1974 (certain trade relief action taken by the President after receiving an affirmative finding regarding serious injury, or threat of serious injury, to a domestic industry in order to facilitate efforts by the domestic industry to make a positive adjustment to import competition), which was transmitted to Congress on March 5, 2002 (imposition of tariffs on imported steel).
